cab.content: 0*Military Secret.1042from Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of State for India,9th August 1919.(Received 9th.)10790. 8th August. No. 89.Part I. 1. Abdul Hatin, son of Umra Khan, is reported to have arrived in Bajaur with a view to enlisting Bajauris for Afghan army.2. Nawab of Dir is reported to be moving to attack Upper Swat.3, In addition to lashkar in Khaicora (vide my 68, dated 7th August) Mullah Fazl Din is reported with 1,000 Mahsuds and Waziris in neighbourhood of Jandola.4. Convoy reached Hindubagh 6th August without incident.5. Hazara deserters evince bitter feelings against Afghans on account of Simni Shiah riots in Kandahar resulting in the deaths of large numbers of Shiahs of both sexes.6. Meshed reports posts on Herat border have been strengthened. War spirit in Herat said to be low.Part II. 7. Baluchistan reports that owing to breach on Lorali-Harnai road, Zhob column will not be ready to leave Murgha till 14th.Para. 7 not communicated to Press.
